title: Can you still feel a limb that's gone? - Joshua W. Pate

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary cause of phantom limb sensations?

options.label: C
options.text: Increased representation of the body part in the cortex

options.label: D
options.text: Decreased representation of the body part in the cortex

multiple-choice.question: What is the cortical homunculus?

options.label: A
options.text: A model of the human body with proportions based on the size of each body part's representation in the cortex

options.label: B
options.text: A technique used to treat phantom pain

multiple-choice.question: What is responsible for processing sensory input from the body?

options.label: D
options.text: The dorsal horn of the spinal cord

multiple-choice.question: What is mirror box therapy?

options.label: A
options.text: A technique used to treat phantom pain

multiple-choice.question: What is virtual reality treatment?

options.label: D
options.text: A technique used to make the experience of mirror box therapy even more lifelike

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary treatment for phantom pain?

options.label: D
options.text: A combination of physical therapy, medications for pain management, prosthetics, and time

multiple-choice.question: Why do some amputees escape the pain typically associated with phantom limbs?

options.label: A
options.text: Because they have a strong willpower

options.label: B
options.text: Because they have a strong support system

options.label: C
options.text: Because they have a different type of prosthetic

options.label: D
options.text: Because the exact cause is still unknown

multiple-choice.question: Why do some amputees not have phantom limbs at all?

options.label: A
options.text: Because they have a strong willpower

options.label: B
options.text: Because they have a strong support system

options.label: C
options.text: Because they have a different type of prosthetic

options.label: D
options.text: Because the exact cause is still unknown

multiple-choice.question: What is the significance of phantom limbs in understanding the brain?

options.label: A
options.text: They are a rare phenomenon that is not relevant to understanding the brain

options.label: B
options.text: They are a complex phenomenon that can provide insight into the workings of the brain

options.label: C
options.text: They are a simple phenomenon that can be easily explained by the brain

options.label: D
options.text: They are a phenomenon that is not related to the brain

multiple-choice.question: What is the main takeaway from the study of phantom limbs?

options.label: A
options.text: That the brain is not capable of experiencing pain

options.label: B
options.text: That the brain is not capable of creating phantom sensations

options.label: C
options.text: That the brain plays a significant role in shaping our perception of the world

options.label: D
options.text: That the brain is not capable of adapting to changes in the body

title: The "End Of History" Illusion - Bence Nanay

multiple-choice.question: What is the concept of the "end of history illusion"?

options.label: A
options.text: The idea that people tend to believe that they are already who they will be in the future

options.label: B
options.text: The concept that people tend to overestimate their capacity for change

options.label: C
options.text: The phenomenon where people assume that how things are now is how they will continue to be

options.label: D
options.text: The idea that people tend to underestimate their personal change

multiple-choice.question: What was the purpose of the 2013 paper that identified the end of history illusion?

options.label: A
options.text: To study the effects of social media on personal change

options.label: B
options.text: To investigate the relationship between personality traits and values

options.label: C
options.text: To explore the concept of the end of history illusion

options.label: D
options.text: To examine the impact of education on personal growth

multiple-choice.question: What did the researchers find when comparing the predicted changes to the reported changes in the 2013 paper?

options.label: A
options.text: That people's future estimates of change came up short compared to the changes their older counterparts recalled

options.label: B
options.text: That people's future estimates of change were accurate compared to the changes their older counterparts recalled

options.label: C
options.text: That people's future estimates of change were significantly higher than the changes their older counterparts recalled

options.label: D
options.text: That people's future estimates of change were significantly lower than the changes their older counterparts recalled

multiple-choice.question: What is one consequence of the end of history illusion?

options.label: A
options.text: People tend to underinvest in future choices based on present preferences

options.label: B
options.text: People tend to overinvest in future choices based on present preferences

options.label: C
options.text: People tend to make more informed decisions

options.label: D
options.text: People tend to be more prepared for the future

multiple-choice.question: What is the end of history illusion also related to in the wider world?

options.label: A
options.text: The idea that people tend to assume that how things are now is how they will continue to be

options.label: B
options.text: The concept that people tend to overestimate their capacity for change

options.label: C
options.text: The phenomenon where people assume that the world does not change

options.label: D
options.text: The idea that people tend to underestimate their personal change

multiple-choice.question: What is one example of how the end of history illusion can lead to miscalculations in more serious commitments?

options.label: A
options.text: People tend to pay more to see their current favorite musician in the future than they would to see their favorite musician from ten years ago

options.label: B
options.text: People tend to invest more in their current job than they would in a new job

options.label: C
options.text: People tend to spend more on their current home than they would on a new home

options.label: D
options.text: People tend to commit more to their current partner than they would to a new partner

multiple-choice.question: What is one way to be aware of the end of history illusion?

options.label: A
options.text: By recognizing the potential for change

options.label: B
options.text: By assuming that how things are now is how they will continue to be

multiple-choice.question: What is one benefit of being aware of the end of history illusion?

options.label: A
options.text: People can make more informed decisions

options.label: B
options.text: People can be better prepared for the future

options.label: C
options.text: People can avoid making long-term commitments

options.label: D
options.text: People can underestimate their personal change

multiple-choice.question: What is one historical example of how the world does change?

options.label: B
options.text: The end of the Cold War

options.label: C
options.text: The fall of the Berlin Wall

options.label: D
options.text: The discovery of the New World

multiple-choice.question: What is one way to make informed long-term plans?

options.label: A
options.text: By assuming that how things are now is how they will continue to be

options.label: B
options.text: By recognizing the potential for change

title: How can you change someone's mind? (hint: facts aren't always enough) - Hugo Mercier

options.text: Anger, disgust, fear, surprise, sadness, and happiness, and contempt

title: How one scientist averted a national health crisis - Andrea Tone

options.label: C

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: Because she thought the drug was too effective.

multiple-choice.question: What were the consequences of Kelsey's actions regarding thalidomide?

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: The FDA was shut down, and Kelsey was fired.

options.label: D

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: Laws that decreased the authority of the FDA.

options.text: It had no impact on the pharmaceutical industry.

options.label: D
options.text: It led to a increase in the number of new drugs being developed, but with less stringent safety testing.

options.label: A

options.label: C

options.label: D
options.text: She was a lawyer who specialized in pharmaceutical law.

title: Can you solve the penniless pilgrim riddle? - Dan Finkel

multiple-choice.question: What is the unique tax rule in Duonia?

options.label: A
options.text: The tax increases by one silver for every block walked east.

options.label: B
options.text: The tax doubles for every block walked south.

options.label: C
options.text: The tax halves for every block walked north and subtracts two silver for every block walked west.

options.label: D
options.text: The tax remains the same for every block walked in any direction.

options.label: B
options.text: The tax increases by one silver.

options.label: C
options.text: The tax decreases by one silver.

multiple-choice.question: What is the effect of each counterclockwise loop on the pilgrim's tax?

options.label: B
options.text: The tax increases by one silver.

options.label: C
options.text: The tax decreases by one silver.

options.label: B
options.text: The debt increases by one silver.

options.label: C
options.text: The debt decreases by one silver.

multiple-choice.question: What is the final debt of the pilgrim after walking three blocks south and three blocks west?
Why can't the pilgrim walk the same block twice?

options.label: A
options.text: Because of the unique tax rule.

multiple-choice.question: What is the key takeaway from the pilgrim's journey?

options.label: A
options.text: Sometimes a direct route is the best way to reach the destination.

options.label: B
options.text: Sometimes an indirect route is the best way to reach the destination.

options.label: C
options.text: The unique tax rule is the most important thing to consider.

options.label: D
options.text: The pilgrim's rules are the most important thing to consider.
